Interface IGT668

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IGT668Slr

    GT668Dummy, GT668Slr

    • Method Detail

      • autoPrescale

        Prescale autoPrescale(int channel)
        This function measures the minimum input prescaling needed for the input signal.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        - 0 - input channel A
        - 1 - input channel B
        Returns:
        Returns prescaling setting measured.
        See Also:
        Prescale

      • blockArmCommand

        boolean blockArmCommand(boolean arm)
        This function sets the level of the software arm signal for block arming.
        Parameters:
        arm -
        - True - set arm signal high
        - False - set arm signal low
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • boardNumber

        boolean boardNumber(int device,
                    int board)
        This function maps a physical board number (determined by the order in which the operating system scans all computer slots) into a logical device number. By default device number is the same as the board number. NOTE: This function should be called before calling initialize method for the same board number or the same device number.
        Parameters:
        device - logical device number
        board - physical board number
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • close

        void close()
        This function closes the current board.

      • enumerateBoard

        int enumerateBoard(boolean first)
        This function enumerates all GT668 boards in the computer. This function can be called at any time, even before any call to initialize.
        Parameters:
        first - Should be set to true on the first call and to false on all subsequent calls
        Returns:
        When B{first} is set to I{True} the function will return the first board number found (lowest number), when B{first} is set to I{False} it will return the next board number found, if no more boards are found the function will return -1.

      • getBaseSeconds

        int getBaseSeconds()
        This function retrieves the current setting of the base seconds. (See setBaseSeconds method).
        Returns:
        Base seconds value.

        Returns:
        Returns retrieved setting.

        Coupling getInputCoupling(Signal signal)
        This function retrieves the current settings of the input coupling of an input signal (Coupling.GT_CPL_DC or Coupling.GT_CPL_AC). Clock and Arm signal will always return Coupling.GT_CPL_DC. Clock and Arm signal will always return
        Parameters:
        signal - Signal
        - Signal.GT_SIG_A - Input channel A
        - Signal.GT_SIG_B - Input channel B
        - Signal.GT_SIG_CLK - Clock input
        - Signal.GT_SIG_ARM - Arm Input
        Returns:
        Returns the retrieved Coupling setting.
        See Also:
        Coupling

        - Signal.GT_SIG_B - Input channel B

        - Signal.GT_SIG_ARM - Arm Input

        Returns the retrieved Impedance setting.
        See Also:
        Impedance

      • getTotalPrescale

        int getTotalPrescale(int channel)
        This function retrieves the total current prescaling of a measurement channel. The total prescaling is calculated by multiplying the prescaling of the input signal selected for this measurement channel and the measurements prescaling. If the input prescaling is set to Prescale.GT_DIV_AUTO the function will use the prescaling value selected during the last call to startMeasurements.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        - 0 - input channel A
        - 1 - input channel B
        Returns:
        Returns the retrieved Prescale setting.

      • initDefault

        void initDefault(boolean keepRef)
        This function initializes the current board to default setup, with the possible exception of the reference clock selection (to avoid settling time penalty).
        Parameters:
        keepRef - If keep_ref is true the current clock reference selection will be kept unchanged, if it's false the clock reference will be set to default value (internal clock).

      • initialize

        boolean initialize(int device)
        This function initializes a board and selects it as the current one.
        Parameters:
        device - Board number to initialize.
        Returns:
        Returns false if initialization failed, true if initialization was successful.

      • isInitialized

        boolean isInitialized(int device)
        This function checks if a board is initialized.
        Parameters:
        device - Board number to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if initialized, false if not.

      • select

        boolean select(int device)
        This function selects a board. All subsequent operations will apply to this board.
        Parameters:
        device - Board number to select.
        Returns:
        Returns false if selection failed (probably board was not initialized), true if selection was successful.

      • selfCal

        boolean selfCal()
        This function runs self-calibration.
        Returns:
        Returns false if self-calibration failed,, true if self-calibration was successful.

      • setArmAuxOut

        boolean setArmAuxOut(ArmAuxOut arm)
        This function selects the arming output to the AUX bus.
        Parameters:
        arm -
        - ArmAuxOut.GT_AUX_OUT_OFF - No arming on the AUX bus
        - ArmAuxOut.GT_AUX_OUT_BA - Output the block arm to AUX
        - ArmAuxOut.GT_AUX_OUT_TA0 - Output the tag arm from channel 0 to AUX
        - ArmAuxOut.GT_AUX_OUT_TA1 - Output the tag arm from channel 1 to AUX
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.
        See Also:
        ArmAuxOut

      • setBlockArm

        boolean setBlockArm(BlkArmSrc blk,
                    Polarity polarity,
                    boolean level)
        This function selects the block arming source.
        Parameters:
        blk -
        - {BlkArmSrc#GT_BA_IMM} - Arm immediately when the channel is ready
        - {BlkArmSrc#GT_BA_SW} - Arm by software call to TagArmSrc
        - {BlkArmSrc#GT_BA_EXT} - Arm from edge of external ARM signal
        - {BlkArmSrc#GT_BA_AUX} - Arm from arming signal on AUX bus
        - {BlkArmSrc#GT_BA_CH0} - Arm from measurement channel 0
        - {BlkArmSrc#GT_BA_CH1} - Arm from measurement channel 1
        - {BlkArmSrc#GT_BA_OFF} - Do not arming (same as disabling the channel)
        polarity -
        - Polarity.GT_POL_POS - Use positive edge of external Arm
        - Polarity.GT_POL_NEG - Use negative edge of external Arm
        level - level
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setBaseSeconds

        boolean setBaseSeconds(int seconds)
        This function sets a base in whole seconds for the following time tags (future time tags value will be relative to this value). The base seconds is used to eliminate the problem of lost resolution over long time intervals (1000 seconds and more). Because the time tags are represented as double precision floating point numbers when the time value gets above 1000 seconds the least significant bit becomes 1 ps and from there on resolution will be lost. Setting the base seconds of the time tags to 1000 (for example) with a call to setBaseSeconds(1000) will reduce the time tag value to a value close to 0 with least significant bit of 1 fs. Default value of base seconds is 0.
        Parameters:
        seconds - Base seconds for the following time tags. The value must be less than or equal to the seconds' part of the last time tag.
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setInputCoupling

        boolean setInputCoupling(Signal signal,
                         Coupling coupling)
        This function sets the input coupling of a measured signal to DC or to AC. NOTE: Clock and Arm signals support only DC coupling.
        Parameters:
        signal - Signal
        - Signal.GT_SIG_A - Input channel A
        - Signal.GT_SIG_B - Input channel B
        - Signal.GT_SIG_CLK - Clock input
        - Signal.GT_SIG_ARM - Arm Input
        coupling - Coupling
        - Coupling.GT_CPL_DC - DC coupling
        - Coupling.GT_CPL_AC - AC coupling
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.
        See Also:
        Coupling

      • setInputImpedance

        boolean setInputImpedance(Signal signal,
                          Impedance impedance)
        This function sets the input impedance of a measured signal to low impedance (50 Ohm) or to high impedance (1 KOhm). NOTE: Clock and Arm signals support only high impedance.
        Parameters:
        signal - Signal
        - Signal.GT_SIG_A - Input channel A
        - Signal.GT_SIG_B - Input channel B
        - Signal.GT_SIG_CLK - Clock input
        - Signal.GT_SIG_ARM - Arm Input
        impedance - Impedance
        - Impedance.GT_IMP_LO - Low impedance
        - Impedance.GT_IMP_HI - High impedance
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.
        See Also:
        Impedance

      • setInputPrescale

        boolean setInputPrescale(Signal signal,
                         Prescale prescale)
        This function sets the hardware input prescaling of a measured signal to divide the input by a power of 2 value between 1 and 1024. The prescaling must be high enough to reduce the measured signal to a frequency under 4MHz. NOTE: Clock and Arm signals do not support prescaling (same as Prescale.GT_DIV_1).
        Parameters:
        signal - Signal
        - Signal.GT_SIG_A - Input channel A
        - Signal.GT_SIG_B - Input channel B
        - Signal.GT_SIG_CLK - Clock input
        - Signal.GT_SIG_ARM - Arm Input
        prescale - Impedance
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_AUTO - Select automatically the minimal prescaling value needed to bring the signal under 4MHz
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_1 - divide by 1 (no prescaling)
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_2 - divide by 2
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_4 - divide by 4
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_8 - divide by 8
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_16 - divide by 16
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_32 - divide by 32
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_64 - divide by 64
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_128 - divide by 128
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_256 - divide by 256
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_512 - divide by 512
        - Prescale.GT_DIV_1024 - divide by 1024
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setInputThreshold

        boolean setInputThreshold(Signal signal,
                          ThresholdMode thresholdMode,
                          double value)
        This function sets the input threshold either to a specific voltage value or to a percentage from a measured peak to peak voltage.
        Parameters:
        signal - Signal
        - Signal.GT_SIG_A - Input channel A
        - Signal.GT_SIG_B - Input channel B
        - Signal.GT_SIG_CLK - Clock input
        - Signal.GT_SIG_ARM - Arm Input
        thresholdMode - ThresholdMode
        - ThresholdMode.GT_THR_PERCENTS - Set threshold by percentage of peak-to-peak
        - ThresholdMode.GT_THR_VOLTS - Set threshold to absolute voltage
        value - Threshold to be used, either in percentage or in Volts according to the value of thresholdMode
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setMeasEnable

        boolean setMeasEnable(int channel,
                      boolean enabled)
        This function enables or disables a measurement channel.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        - 0 - input channel A
        - 1 - input channel B
        enabled -
        - true - enabled
        - false - disabled
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setMeasInput

        boolean setMeasInput(int channel,
                     InputSel inputSel)
        This function selects the input source for a measurement channel.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        - 0 - input channel A
        - 1 - input channel B
        inputSel - InputSel
        - InputSel.GT_CHA_POS - Measure positive edges on input channel A
        - InputSel.GT_CHA_NEG - Measure negative edges on input channel A
        - InputSel.GT_CHB_POS - Measure positive edges on input channel B
        - InputSel.GT_CHB_NEG - Measure negative edges on input channel B
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setMeasSkip

        boolean setMeasSkip(int channel,
                    int skip)
        This function sets the measurements skip rate for a measurement channel. This will cause the measurement channel to drop rate out of every (rate + 1) time tags. If rate value is 0 - no prescaling will be done.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        - 0 - input channel A
        - 1 - input channel B
        skip - Prescaling value (0 to 999999)
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setMeasTagArm

        boolean setMeasTagArm(int channel,
                      TagArmSrc tagArmSrc,
                      Polarity polarity)
        This function selects the time tag arming source for a measurement channel.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        - 0 - input channel A
        - 1 - input channel B
        tagArmSrc - TagArmSrc
        - TagArmSrc.GT_TA_IMM - Arm immediately when the channel is ready
        - TagArmSrc.GT_TA_SW - Arm by software call to tagArmCommand
        - TagArmSrc.GT_TA_EXT - Arm from edge of external ARM signal
        - TagArmSrc.GT_TA_AUX - Arm from arming signal on AUX bus
        - TagArmSrc.GT_TA_OTHER - Arm from other channel
        - TagArmSrc.GT_TA_OFF - Do not arming (same as disabling the channel)
        polarity -
        - Polarity.GT_POL_POS - Use positive edge of external Arm
        - Polarity.GT_POL_NEG - Use negative edge of external Arm
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setMemoryWrapMode

        boolean setMemoryWrapMode(boolean wrapMode)
        This function enables or disabled the "wrap" mode of the instrument's memory. If "wrap" mode is enable the instrument will work continuously (as long as the user reads the time tags fast enough). If "wrap" mode is disabled the instrument will fill the memory and stop.
        Parameters:
        wrapMode -
        - true - "Wrap" mode enabled
        - false - Wrap" mode disabled
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setReferenceClock

        boolean setReferenceClock(RefClkSrc refClkSrc,
                          boolean ref5MHz,
                          boolean auxOut)
        This function selects the source of the instrument's clock.
        Parameters:
        refClkSrc - RefClkSrc
        - RefClkSrc.GT_REF_INTERNAL - Use the internal clock on-board.
        - RefClkSrc.GT_REF_EXTERNAL - Lock to the 10MHz external clock input.
        - RefClkSrc.GT_REF_PXI - Use the clock from the PXI chassis (valid only for GT668PXI boards).
        - RefClkSrc.GT_REF_AUX - Use the clock transmitted on the AUX bus.
        ref5MHz -
        - true - Reference clock is 5MHz (valid only with RefClkSrc.GT_REF_EXTERNAL option)
        - false - Reference clock is 10MHz
        auxOut -
        - true - Output the selected clock to the AUX bus (invalid with RefClkSrc.GT_REF_AUX option)
        - false - Do not output clock to the AUX bus
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • setT0Mode

        boolean setT0Mode(boolean enb,
                  boolean rel)
        This function configure the T0 mode. The arm value selects if the reference time (t0) will be generated from the block arming tag (with 20ns resolution) or from the first time tag (full channel resolution). The rel value selects if the T0 value will be subtracted from all time tags.
        Parameters:
        enb -
        - true - t0 generated from block arm
        - false - t0 generated from first time tag
        rel -
        - true - t0 will be subtracted from all time tags
        - false - t0 will not be subtracted from all time tags
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • startMeasurements

        boolean startMeasurements()
        This function loads the user specified configuration into the instrument and starts a set of measurements.
        Returns:
        Returns false if failed, true if successful.

      • stopMeasurements

        boolean stopMeasurements()
        This function stops the measurements.
        Returns:
        Returns false if failed, true if successful.

      • tagArmCommand

        boolean tagArmCommand(boolean channel0,
                      boolean channel1)
        This function sets the level of the software arm signals for tag arming on both measurement channels.
        Parameters:
        channel0 -
        - true - set arm signal for channel 0 high
        - false - set arm signal for channel 0 low
        channel1 -
        - true - set arm signal for channel 1 high
        - false - set arm signal for channel 1 low
        Returns:
        Returns false if setting failed, true if setting was successful.

      • measureAmplitude

        AmplitudeSet measureAmplitude(Signal signal,
                              double minFreq)
        This function measures the peak voltages of an input signal. Because the measurement is done by a threshold search the measurement can be slow if the frequency of the signal is low. The measurement takes about 60 msec + 36 * (signal maximum period).
        Parameters:
        signal - Signal
        - Signal.GT_SIG_A - Input channel A
        - Signal.GT_SIG_B - Input channel B
        - Signal.GT_SIG_CLK - Clock input
        - Signal.GT_SIG_ARM - Arm Input
        minFreq - Minimum frequency of the measured signal. Using a value lower than necessary may slow down the measurement.
        Returns:
        Returns measured amplitude values.
        See Also:
        AmplitudeSet

      • getErrorMessage

        java.lang.String getErrorMessage(int error)
        This function translates an error code (returned from getError) in to an error message.
        Parameters:
        error - Error code.
        Returns:
        The error message.

      • readTimetags

        TimetagsSet readTimetags(int toReadOnCh0,
                         int toReadOnCh1)
        The function will read up-to the requested number of time tags, but will stop sooner if the number of time tags available is smaller.
        Parameters:
        toReadOnCh0 - The number of time tags from channel 0 to read.
        toReadOnCh1 - The number of time tags from channel 1 to read
        Returns:
        Returns obtained Timetags.
        See Also:
        TimetagsSet

      • readRaw

        RawTimetagsSet readRaw(int count,
                       int offset)
        This function reads requested amount of raw time tags. The function will read up-to the requested number of words, but will stop sooner if the number of words available is smaller. The data can be converted to double precision time tags by calling the convertRawToTimetags method.
        Note: In "wrap" mode the offset parameter is ignored. Each call to this function will read from the point where the last read ended.
        Parameters:
        count - The number (in 32-bit words) of the raw data words to read.
        offset - The index (in 32-bit words) of the first raw data word to read. It is ignored in memory "wrap" mode (see note above).
        Returns:
        Returns retrieved data.
        See Also:
        RawTimetagsSet

      • convertRawToTimetags

        ConvertedTimetagsSet convertRawToTimetags(int[] rawTags,
                                          int tagsAvailable,
                                          int readCh0,
                                          int readCh1)
        This function converts raw time tags data (read using the readRaw method). The function will read up-to the requested number of time tags, but will stop sooner if the number of raw time tags available is smaller.
        Parameters:
        rawTags - Array of raw data.
        tagsAvailable - The number (in 32-bit words) of raw data words available to convert.
        readCh0 - The number of time tags from channel 0 to read.
        readCh1 - The number of time tags from channel 1 to read.
        Returns:
        Returns retrieved data (converted tags).
        See Also:
        ConvertedTimetagsSet

      • readSysTime

        double readSysTime()
        This function reads on-board time.
        Returns:
        Returns system time read from the board.
